content.webTitle: Eva Wiseman: How to be ... an Andrew Lloyd Webber protege

fields.headline: How to be ...
fields.bodyText: In order to catch Andrew Lloyd Webber's eye (the good one, not the sunken dromedaic effort) and join his squad of sensitive sopranos, you'll have to work hard. Sarah Brightman put in serious time as a member of Hot Gossip; Elaine Paige dragged up as an elderly cat; Connie Fisher left a lucrative career in telesales; and Summer Strallen agreed to live an eerie half-life, appearing as a plant in Hollyoaks before she took the stage. Your best bet at meeting Lloyd Webber now is on his latest talent show - I'd Do Anything, BBC1's quest to fill his next production of Oliver. It's laid out like a stage school with Lloyd Webber squatting in the middle on a plastic throne. He's got a face on him, hasn't he, that one? But it doesn't matter to you, an aspirant Nancy, because every second brings you a step closer to this, the chance to emote for Andy, live-ish, on prime-time TV. And then to pretend to be a battered woman behind Oxford Street, twice nightly.
